titleStmt.title: James E. Temple to James W. Tate
CWG7934

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Memphis Tenn
Apl 16th 1863
Jas W Tate Esq --
Asst Secy of State
Dear Sir --

Your esteemed favor of Jany 12th enclosing me a commission -- constituting the Commissioner of Deeds of the state of Kentucky has been in receipt for some time past. Herein enclosed you will find my oath of office together with your fee of Five Dollars in a treasury note which you will please acknowledge the receipt of. The dearth of business engendered by this war is my apology for not send the fee and my oath of office more promptly

Yours
Very Respfly
James E Temple
